revised_title: The Evolution of Coupling Constants in Physics
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of coupling constants in physics, specifically the strong, electromagnetic, and weak couplings. It explores the convergence of these couplings to a single "grand unified" coupling at higher energies and the uncertainties in calculating the proton lifetime in minimal theories. The article also touches upon the concept of energy-dependent couplings and their implications for grand unification and the role of lattice QCD in calculating these constants.
